summary: This is an internal email reporting that Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch. It also notes his cellmate reported being threatened and that the incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: Advised the reporting party about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein in the prison.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email reporting the incident received from the Bureau of Prisons.

connections.description: The Associate Warden was responsible for the facility where Epstein was incarcerated and reported on his condition.

connections.person2: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
connections.description: The Marshal was reporting on an incident involving Epstein while he was in federal custody.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was assessed, placed on suicide watch, and later downgraded to suicide observation.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on the morning of July 25, 2019, with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened, though no further details were provided.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the report.
